title: BETMGM logo inside the app
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing the Games screen

custom_steps_separated.content: If user is under 21
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user should not see the BETMGM logo

![](index.php?/attachments/get/26576)

custom_steps_separated.content: If user is over 21
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user should see the BETMGM logo

![](index.php?/attachments/get/34126)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user opens the Games page and their device time is set to earlier than 8am ET
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN games from the previous day should be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user opens the Games page and their device time is set to after 8am ET
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN games scheduled for today should be displayed

title: Time Zone / Time format

custom_steps_separated.content: Update the time zone
custom_steps_separated.expected: time of the game should be updated

custom_steps_separated.content: Update the time format to the military
custom_steps_separated.expected: no am/pm should be displayed

title: Games tab - no game day
custom_preconds: No games are scheduled for today
custom_expected:
- No games are displayed in the Games tab 
- 'No games to show' text is displayed

title: Games tab - with games
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user launches the app
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the Games tab
custom_expected:
1. The game should display the current status 
2. AND the team names and logos should be displayed correctly (if there is no available team logo a baseball is displayed.)
3. AND the game should be clickable and take you to the active game flow

![](index.php?/attachments/get/26580)

title: CAB Prop State when Game State Changes
custom_preconds: Player answered the prop and later the game status changes (postponed, suspended, or cancelled).

custom_steps_separated.content: postponed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. if prop OPEN → WITHDRAW
2. if prop LOCKED → VOID
3. WITHDRAW onDeck/inHole props once the game state changes to POSTPONED. 
4. All pregame props should be voided

custom_steps_separated.content: suspended
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. if prop OPEN → WITHDRAW
2. if prop LOCKED → VOID
3. All pregame props should be voided

custom_steps_separated.content: cancelled
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. if prop OPEN → WITHDRAW
2. if prop LOCKED → VOID
3. All pregame props should be voided

title: Feature:  Download App
custom_preconds: Given:  User has downloaded the Rally iOS App from the App Store
custom_steps: When user is viewing the initial screen
custom_expected:
Then the user sees a darkened B&W background image of a player
   And the "Rally" logo
   And a "Sign Up" button
   And a "Login" button

title: Feature:  Sign Up
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the first screen after downloading the App
custom_steps: When user taps the "Sign Up" button
custom_expected:
Then the "Sign Up" screen opens
   And "Create an MLB.com account..." text displays
   And an Email field displays
   And a Nickname field is present
   And a Password field is visible
   And a Birthdate field
   And a Sign Up button (disabled)

title: Feature:  Complete Sign Up fields
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Sign Up" screen
custom_steps: When the user enters valid text in the fields
custom_expected:
Then "By signing up I acknowledge..." message appears 
   And the "Sign Up" button is now enabled

title: Feature:  Sign Up button
custom_preconds: Given:  User has completed the "Sign Up" fields
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Sign Up" button
custom_expected:
Then the "Notifications" screen opens
   And a blue and white graphic displays
   And "Rally uses push notifications..." text is visible
   under the graphic
   And an "Enable Notifications" button displays
   And a "Skip For Now" link is visible

title: Feature:  Skip For Now link
custom_preconds: Given:  User has signed up and is on the "Notifications" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Skip For Now" link
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the "Select Your Team" screen

title: Feature:  Enable Notifications dialogue
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Notifications" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Enable Notifications" button
custom_expected: Then a dialogue box displays:  "MLB Rally" Would Like to Send You Notifications"

title: Feature:  Allow Notifications
custom_preconds:
Given:  User has tapped "Enable Notifications"
   And is viewing the Notifications dialogue box
custom_steps: When the user taps "Allow"
custom_expected:
Then the "Select Your Team" screen opens
   And show an array of Team names under logos
   And the array is 3 columns and 10 rows
   And a "Next" button (disabled) is pinned to the bottom of the screen

title: Feature:  Select Your Team
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Select Your Team" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps one team in the array
custom_expected:
Then the team name/logo tile displays in a frame that is the primary color of that team's logo
   And the "Next" button is enabled

title: Feature: Next from the  "Select Your Team" screen
custom_preconds:
Given:  User has selected a Team from the "Select Your Team" screen
   And the "Next" button is enabled
custom_steps: When the user taps "Next"
custom_expected:
Then a Welcome screen opens
   And the header reads "Welcome <Nickname>
   And "I acknowledge..." text displays
   And a "Play" button is present and enabled

title: Feature:  Play button
custom_preconds:
Given:  User is on the Welcome screen
   And the "Play" button is present and enabled
custom_steps: When the user taps "Play"
custom_expected:
Then a new screen opens with text:  "Welcome <Nickname> First Time?  Tap here to learn how to play Rally."
   And the Rally logo displays at top of screen
   And today's date displays
   And an array of tiles (stack) display showing the 
   match-ups of today's games

title: Feature:  Lean how to play Rally
custom_preconds:
Given:  User is viewing the screen, 
"Welcome <Nickname> First Time?  
Tap here to learn how to play Rally."
custom_steps: When the user taps the Welcome message
custom_expected:
Then the "How To Play" screen opens
   And "Choose A Game" header displays
   And "Select any..." text displays
   And five dots are visible at the bottom indicating the screen is the first in a carousel

title: Feature:  'How To Play' carousel
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Choose A Game" screen of the carousel
custom_steps: When the user repeatedly swipes left
custom_expected:
Then each of the "How To Play" screens display:   
   And each shows a header, an animated graphic and text
   And second card is "View Your Stack"
   And the third is "Make Your Picks"
   And the fourth is "Follow the Action"
   And the fifth (last screen in the carousel is "See Your Results"
   And the last screen displays a "Got It" button
   And the "How To Play" header includes an "X" button to return to the previous screen

title: Feature:  Carousel exit
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the last screen of the "How To Play" carousel
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Got It" button
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected back to the "Welcome <User Nickname> screen and a stack
of today's cards is present under the 'Welcome' message and today's day/date

title: Feature:  Log Out
custom_preconds: Given:  from any screen, tap the "Profile" button in the bottom navigation
custom_steps: When the user scrolls to the bottom of the screen and taps "Log Out"
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the Sign Up/Log In screen

title: Under 21 Signup
custom_preconds: Given You are on the Signup Page
custom_steps: When you enter a birthday that makes you younger than 21 years old
custom_expected: Then you should be redirected to a screen that says you are ineligible to play. You should not be able to dismiss the screen and can't access the app unless you completely uninstall and reinstall.

title: Feature:  Login (as an existing user) screen
custom_preconds: Given:  User has opened the Rally App and is viewing The Login screen
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Login" button
custom_expected:
Then the Login screen opens
   And an Email field is present
   And a "Password" field displays
   And a "Forgot Your Password" link is visible
   And a "Login" button is present (and disabled)
   And a "Don't have an account?  Sign Up" link displays

title: Feature:  Login fields enabling Log In button
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the Log In screen
custom_steps:
When the user enters valid text in the "Email" field
   And enters valid text in the 'Password" field
custom_expected: Then the "Log In" button is enabled

title: Feature:  Enabled  Login button
custom_preconds:
Given:  User has entered valid text in the "Email" and "Password" fields
   And the "Log In" button is enabled
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Login" button
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to the "Notifications" screen
   And the screen show a "Continue" 'racetrack' button

title: Feature:  Log in (negative)  message
custom_preconds: Given:  User is on the "Log In" screen and has entered invalid text
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Login" button
custom_expected: Then an error message displays:  "Please enter a valid email/password"

title: Feature:  Forgot Your  Password?
custom_preconds:
Given:  User has tapped the "Forgot Your Password?" link and the "Forgot Password" screen displays
   And the screen contains an email field
   And the screen shows a "Reset Password" button
custom_steps:
When the user enters his/her email address
   And taps the "Reset Password" button
custom_expected: Then "A password reset link has been sent to you via email" message displays

title: Feature:  MLB Account  Password Reset
custom_preconds: Given:  "A password reset link has been sent to you via email" message has displayed
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to his/her email inbox
   And opens the "MLB Account Password 
   Reset" email
   And taps the "Reset Password" button in the body of the email
custom_expected:
Then the "Reset your password" screen opens
   And a "New password" field displays
   And a "Repeat password" field is present

title: Feature:  Enter new password
custom_preconds: Given:  User has entered a valid password in the "New password" and "Repeat password" fields
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Save" button
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the MLB App

title: Feature:  Open the Rally App
custom_preconds: Given:  User has opened the Rally App and is on the landing screen
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the screen
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the "Rally" logo header
   And "Welcome <User Name> text
   And "Choose any game..." text
   And today's day/date
   And a list of tiles of today's games

title: Feature:  Game tile
custom_preconds: Given:  User is on the landing screen before any of the day's games have started
custom_steps: When the user is viewing a tile
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the status of the game (e.g. "Pre-Game")
   And the teams playing (using team, not city names; e.g. Twins, Cardinals)
   And a "Play Now" label
   And the start time of the game
   And the time zone

title: Feature:  Game selections
custom_preconds: Given:  User has tapped a tile
custom_steps: When the user is. viewing the screen
custom_expected:
Then the user sees <Twins> @ <Cardinals>
   And "Before the first pitch, make your pre-game picks." text
   And a caret symbol and "Swipe up for the first question" text 
   And the footer shows <Twins> @ <Cardinals>
   And "Pre-game" status

title: Feature:  First question
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the screen inviting the first question
custom_steps: When the user swipes up on the screen
custom_expected:
Then the user sees a card showing <Twins> @ <Cardinals>
   And "Pre-game" status
   And "Which team will win <MIN/STL>?
   And a + icon
   And "Tap to expand" 
   And the footer shows <Twins> @ <Cardinals>
   And "Pre-game" status

title: Feature:  Which team will win
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing "Which team will win <MIN/STL>? card
custom_steps: When the user taps the card
custom_expected:
Then the card expands and the user sees "Which team will win MIN/STL
   And two 'racetrack' buttons, each displaying a team name (not city name) and the number of points assigned to each:  e.g.
   Twins,         145 pts
   Cardinals,     322 pts
   And "Drag down to close" text under a down arrow

title: Feature:  Team selection
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the team selection screen
custom_steps: When the user taps a team name button
custom_expected:
Then the selection/points displays under the "Which team will win..." label
   And a + "Tap to expand" link displays
   And the top of the next card displays from the bottom
   And the footer shows <Twins> @ <Cardinals>
   And "Pre-game" status

title: Tester Note:  (open to view)
custom_preconds:
The questions appearing on the cards of the following tests will vary depending on the game you have chosen. 
Some will be Yes/No, some multiple choice.  
If you find card that doesn't exactly match the test step, please respond to the App, not the test ste

title: Feature:  Open next tile
custom_preconds: Given:  User has selected a game winner and is ready for the first question card
custom_steps: When the user swipes up on the lower card
custom_expected:
Then the first question card opens (e.g. Will <Jose Berrios> allow 5 or more hits
   And a + "Tap to expand" link displays

title: Feature:  Select first card question/selection
custom_preconds:
Given:  User is viewing selection screen for the first card.  
(e.g. Will <Jose Berrios> allow 5 or more hits)
custom_steps: When the user makes a selection (Yes/No) by tapping a 'racetrack' button
custom_expected: Then a new card opens confirming the selection and number of points assigned to that selection

title: Feature:  Reopen the selection card
custom_preconds: Given:  User has made a selection and is viewing the card confirming that selection
custom_steps: When the user taps the + "Tap to expand" link
custom_expected:
Then the original selection screen opens
   And the screen shows the selection button in a selected state (highlighted)
   And the other selection button displays in an unselected state (unhighlighted)

title: Feature:  Change a selection
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the original selection screen and sees his/her selection
custom_steps: When the user taps the other option (the option he/she did not select)
custom_expected: Then the card opens confirming the selection change and number of points assigned to that selection

title: Feature:  Open second card question
custom_preconds: Given:  User has swiped up on the top of the next card and is viewing the question:  "Will <Luis Arraez> have a <double>?
custom_steps: When the user taps to expand
custom_expected:
Then the selection card opens with the question and Yes/No selection options
   And "Will <Luis Arraez> have a <double>? text displays
   And a "Yes" button displays with the number of pts
   And a "No" button displays with the number of pts
   And down arrow over "Drag down to close" text shows

title: Feature:  Select second card answer
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the second selection card: "Will <Luis Arraez> have a <double>?
custom_steps: When the user selects an option (Yes/No)
custom_expected: Then the card opens confirming the selection change, and the number of points assigned to that selection

title: Feature:  Open third card question
custom_preconds: Given:  User has swiped up on the top of the next card and is viewing the question:  "Will <Alex Bohm> have a <hit>?
custom_steps: When the user taps to expand
custom_expected:
Then the selection card opens with the question and Yes/No selection options
   And "Will <Alec Bohm> have a <hit>? text displays
   And a "Yes" button displays with the number of pts
   And a "No" button displays with the number of pts
   And down arrow over "Drag down to close" text shows

title: Feature:  Select third card answer
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the third selection card: "Will <Alex Bohm> have a <hit>?
custom_steps: When the user selects an option (Yes/No)
custom_expected: Then the card opens confirming the selection change, and number of points assigned to that selection

title: Feature:  Open fourth card question
custom_preconds: Given:  User has swiped up on the top of the next card and is viewing the question:  "Who will have more total bases"
custom_steps: When the user taps to expand
custom_expected:
Then the selection card opens with the question and options
   And <J.D. Martinez> <269> pts displays
   And <Rhys Hoskins> <275> pts displays
   And Tie <377> pts displays
   And down arrow over "Drag down to close" text shows

title: Feature:  Select fourth card answer
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the fourth selection card: "Who will have more total bases"
custom_steps: When the user selects an option (<Rhys Hoskins>)
custom_expected: Then the card opens confirming the selection change, and number of points assigned to that selection

title: Feature:  Open fifth card question
custom_preconds: Given:  User has swiped up on the top of the next card and is viewing the question:  "Will <Martin Perez> pitch at least <5> innings?
custom_steps: When the user taps to expand
custom_expected:
Then the selection card opens with the question and Yes/No selection options
   And "Will  <Martin Perez> pitch at least <5> innings? displays
   And a "Yes" button displays with the number of pts
   And a "No" button displays with the number of pts
   And down arrow over "Drag down to close" text shows

title: Feature:  Select fifth card answer
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the fifth selection card: "Who will have more total bases"
custom_steps: When the user selects an option (Yes/No)
custom_expected: Then the card opens confirming the selection change and number of points assigned to that selection

title: Feature:  Completion card
custom_preconds: Given:  User has swiped up on the top of the next card (blue color)
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the card
custom_expected:
Then the user sees a "Picks Complete" card
   And "Change them at any time before the first pitch.
   Get notified when the game starts" text displays
   And an "Enable Notifications" 'racetrack' button displays

title: Feature:  Answer 4 questions
custom_preconds:
Given:  User picks a game winner and selects answers on only 3 additional cards
   And swipes up on the remaining cards
custom_steps: When the user swipes up on the final, blue card
custom_expected:
Then the card reads:  
"You answered 4 out of 5.
Complete them all for more opportunities to increase your score.
Get notified when the game starts"
   And an "Enable Notifications" 'racetrack' button displays"

title: Feature:  Answer 3 questions
custom_preconds:
Given:  User picks a game winner and selects answers on only 2 additional cards
   And swipes up on the remaining cards
custom_steps: When the user swipes up on the final, blue card
custom_expected:
Then the card reads:  
"You answered 3 out of 5.
Complete them all for more opportunities to increase your score
Get notified when the game starts"
   And an "Enable Notifications" 'racetrack' button displays"

title: Feature:  Answer 2 questions
custom_preconds:
Given:  User picks a game winner and selects answers on only 1 additional card    
   And swipes up on the remaining cards
custom_steps: When the user swipes up on the final, blue card
custom_expected:
Then the card reads:  
"You answered 2 out of 5.
Complete them all for more opportunities to increase your score
Get notified when the game starts"
   And an "Enable Notifications" 'racetrack' button displays

title: Feature:  Answer 1 question
custom_preconds:
Given:  User picks a game winner but **does not** provide answers on any remaining cards
   And swipes up on the remaining cards
custom_steps: When the user swipes up on the final, blue card
custom_expected:
Then the card reads:  
"You answered 1 out of 5.
Complete them all for more opportunities to increase your score
Get notified when the game starts"
   And an "Enable Notifications" 'racetrack' button displays

title: Feature:  Profile:  Picks Made/Play Now
custom_preconds: Given:  The user has made picks in two games, **but not** any others
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the screen with a list of tiles of today's games
custom_expected:
Then the user is seeing a green "Picks Made" label on games he/she has made picks
   And the user is seeing the orange "Play Now" label on tiles where no picks have been made

title: Feature:  Bottom Nav bar
custom_preconds: Given:  User is on any screen in the App
custom_steps: When the user views the bottom of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user sees "Games" (default), "Rankings" and "Profile" buttons

title: Feature:  Daily Rankings
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the bottom navigation bar
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Rankings" button
custom_expected:
Then the "Daily Rankings" screen opens
   And text displays:  "The top 3 scores..."
   And the prizes display:  1st Prize, $1,000; 2nd Prize, $500; 3rd Prize $100
   And two date tabs are present and functional; yesterday's date and today's date (e.g. Fri 09/11)
   And a "Top Scores" label is visible (on today's list) with the number of players
   And a "Final Scores" label is visible (on yesterday's list with the number of players
   And a stack of tiles display 
   And each tile shows the place (e.g. 1st Place)
   And each tile shows the <User Nickname>
   And each tile displays the user's rating (e.g. "MVP," "Superstar," "Hall of Famer," etc,)

title: Feature:  Your Profile
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the bottom navigation bar
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Profile" button
custom_expected:
Then the "Your Profile" screen opens
   And the logo of the user's favorite team shows
   And the <User Nickname> displays
   And the user's rating (e.g. <Rookie> shows
   And "Your Total XP" level and points display over a slide bar 
   And the slide bar illustrates the user's point level and the number of points to reach the next level
   And a list of links to other profile components (covered in next test)

title: Feature:  Profile: Favorite Team
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps the "Favorite Team:  <Cubs>" button
custom_expected:
Then the "Select Your Team" screen opens
   And show an array of Team names under logos
   And the array is 3 columns and 10 rows
   And a "Next" button (disabled) is pinned to the bottom of the screen view"

title: Feature:   Change Favorite  Team
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Select Your Team" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps a team logo and clicks the "Update" 'racetrack' button
custom_expected:
Then the user is returned to the "Your Profile" screen
   And the team selected is now visible adjoining the "Favorite Team" label

title: Feature: Profile:  Notifications
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user slides the toggle switch adjoining "Notifications" back and forth
custom_expected: Then the switch opens and closes the "Notifications" toggle

title: Feature: Profile:  Vibrations
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user slides the toggle switch adjoining "Notifications" back and forth
custom_expected: Then the switch opens and closes the "Notifications" toggle

title: Feature:  Profile:  How To Play
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "How To Play"
custom_expected:
Then the "How To Play" screen opens
   And "Choose A Game" header displays
   And "Select any..." text displays
   And five dots are visible at the bottom indicating the screen is the first in a carousel

title: Feature:  How To Play Carousel
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Choose A Game" screen of the carousel
custom_steps: When the user repeatedly swipes left
custom_expected:
Then each of the "How To Play" screens display:   
   And each shows a header, an animated graphic and text
   And second card is "View Your Stack"
   And the third is "Make Your Picks"
   And the fourth is "Follow the Action"
   And the fifth (last screen in the carousel) is "See Your Results"
   And the last screen displays a "Got It" button
   And the "How To Play" header includes an "X" button to return to the previous screen

title: Feature:  Profile:  Account
custom_preconds: Given:  User is logged in and is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "Account"
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to "Your MLB Account"

title: Feature:  Profile:  More MLB Apps
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "More MLB Apps"
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to a "MLB" App screen with an array of Apps:
**Latest Release** (sub head)
-- MLB Rally with an "Open" button present (Open 
   because the user is signed up)
**Apps & Games** (sub head)
-- MLB Rally with an "Open" button present
-- Junior Giants with a "Get" button present
-- RBI Baseball 20 with a $3.99 button present
**iMessage** (sub head)
-- MLB 2016 Sticker Pack  with a "Get" button present
**Apple Watch** (sub head)
-- MLB with with an "Open" button present (If user has an Apple Watch)
**Apple TV** (sub head)
--MLB with an "Open" button present  (If user has Apple TV)

title: Feature:  Profile:  More BetMGM Apps
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "More BetMGM Apps"
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the Apple "App Store" screen: displays the App for MGM Resorts International

title: Feature:  Profile:  Privacy Policy
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "Privacy Policy"
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the "MLB Privacy Policy" screen on the MLB App

title: Feature:  Profile:  Do Not Sell My Data
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps  "Do Not Sell My Data"
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to the "MLB Privacy" screen
   And the screen shows a "Sign In" button
   And show a "Proceed as Guest User" link

title: Feature:  Profile:  MLB Privacy screen
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "MLB Privacy" screen
custom_steps:
When the user enters valid text in the mandatory fields (marked with a red asterisk) 
   And selects the CAPTCHA checkbox
   And clicks "Submit"
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to a screen that reads: 
"One More Step!  
Your identity needs to be confirmed"
   And additional text:  Please check your email..."
   And an email graphic displays at the top of the screen (@ envelope)

title: Feature:  Profile:  Privacy Email
custom_preconds: Given:  User has navigated to their email inbox and locates the "Your Privacy Access Request" email
custom_steps: When the user clicks the green "Confirm Email"
custom_expected:
Then, in a new tab, the user sees a page with a large green circle with a white check mark
   And a header, "Your request is confirmed!" message is visible
   And text, "We will review your request and contact you shortly" displays
   And the bottom of the page shows:
   MLB Privacy
   1271 Avenue of the Americas
   New York, New York 10020
   dataprivacy@mlb.com

title: Feature:  Profile:  Privacy Confirmation Email
custom_preconds:
Given:  Several hours later than the previous test, the user navigates back to their inbox and opens this email:  
"Your Do Not Sell Request Has Been Completed
custom_steps: When the user view the email
custom_expected:
Then the user sees "Your Do Not Sell Request Has Been Completed" in the Subject line
   And an MLB logo displays
   And text reads: "Hello <Mike>,
   We have completed your request under the California Consumer Privacy Act not to sell your personal information.  
   Regards, The MLB Privacy Team"

title: Feature:  Profile:  Terms of Use
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "Terms of Use"
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to the "Terms of Use Agreement" screen on the MLB App
   And the screen contains 15 sections
   And the bottom of the screen shows the standard MLB App footer

title: Feature:  Profile:  Official Rules
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "Official Rules"
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to the "MLB Rally Official Rules" screen on the MLB App
   And the screen contains 15 sections
   And the bottom of the screen shows the standard MLB App footer

title: Feature:  Profile:  FAQ
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "FAQ"
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to "MLB Rally Frequently Asked Questions' screen
   And the screen contains 16 Q/A's

title: Feature:  Profile:   MLB Customer  Service
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "FAQ" screen
custom_steps: When the user scrolls to the bottom of the screen
custom_expected:
Then the user can view the ways to reach MLB Customer Support
   And the 866-800-1275 (phone number) displays
   And the customerservice@website.mlb.com (email address) displays

title: Feature:  Profile:  Log Out
custom_preconds: Given:  User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "Log Out"
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the Sign Up/Log In screen

title: Feature:  Profile:  Game Over  notification
custom_preconds: Given:  The user's mobile device is turned on
custom_steps:
When the user receives a MLB Rally notification
   And the notification reads:  "This game is over!  Final Score:  <White Sox 4> @ <Pirates 5>.  Come see how well you did!
   And the user taps the notification
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the "Scores Complete" screen

title: Feature:  Profile:   Scores Complete
custom_preconds: Given:  A game, in which the user made a pick, has just completed
custom_steps:
When the user opens the app and is viewing the "Scores complete!" screen
   And the user taps the "See My Score" button
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to a series of screens that auto-advances
   And the first screen shows the logos of the teams that have competed
   And the next screen, "Your Final Results"
   And the next screen shows the "Which team will win..." card
   And the name of the team user picked displays, along with the number of points the pick generated
   And that screen is then overlaid with a green screen "Correct" screen or a red (Incorrect) screen, if the pick was incorrect
   And the rest of the screens flow by showing the original question and the correct (green) or incorrect (red) pick
   And a "Total Points Earned" screen opens with the number of points, "Pick Accuracy" <Percent>, "Incorrect Picks" <value> & "Total Picks" 
     <value>
   And the "Game Ranking" screen opens showing the user's points and place in the rankings <value> for that game
   And the screen shows the user's place in the "Daily Rankings"
   And the "Total XP Earned screen opens with the user's total XP
   And the "Level Up" screen opens showing the user's "Total XP," a slide bar showing his/her progress and a level designation (e.g. Rookie)
   And the screen redirects to a splash screen 
   And back to the stack of tiles for today's games

title: Feature:  Profile:   Calculating scores... label on tile
custom_preconds: Given:  User knows (from another source) that the game is over, but has not yet received a notification from Rally
custom_steps:
When the user knows the game is over
   And he/she opens the app and scrolls to the game tile.
custom_expected: Then the user sees a "Calculating Scores..." label on the game tile

title: Feature:  Profile:   Calculating Scores... card
custom_preconds: Given:  User sees a "Calculating Scores..." label in the game tile
custom_steps: When the user taps the tile
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to a blue card that reads:  "Calculating scores..."
   And sees text:  Once all the results are in you'll get your total points and XP reward.

title: Game Rankings
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user starts the app and plays the game
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the three-lined button in the top right of a game
custom_expected:
1. The user should be taken to a Game Rankings screens
2. AND the graphic of the two team logos who are playing should be displayed
3. AND the number of people should be displayed 
4. AND message detailing what rank user is on the Daily Rankings
5. AND the user should be highlighted in blue
6. AND the scores of all users who have made picks in this game are displayed
7. AND each rank has the name of the user, their rank, and their score for the game displayed correctly and in the correct order

title: Animation card
custom_steps:
1. Play the game
2. Exit the game, go back to it after the card is resolved
3. Click on the blue !
custom_expected: Prop wipe happens and animation does not expend the screen size

title: Arrow button
custom_preconds: User is playing the game
custom_expected:
Anytime the user is scrolled away from the current batter card, a blue arrow floating icon should appear.

The direction of the blue arrow should reflect the direction that the current AB card is from where they are in the deck. So, if it is below user's current position, it should point down. Otherwise, point up. 

Pressing the blue arrow floating icon should quick-scroll the user to the current At-bat or Batter Up card. 

Anytime the user is currently scrolled to the current At-bat or Batter Up card, the floating arrow icon should go away.

In cases, when the current prop gets resolved and there is no active props yet (At Bat or Batter Up), the arrow button should not be displayed.

title: Prop Vibration
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is viewing props inside of a contest AND vibrations are turned on in settings
custom_steps: WHEN an On Deck prop turns into an active prop
custom_expected: THEN a short vibration should be sent to their device

title: Pitchcast
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user clicks into an active game
custom_steps: WHEN the batter begins receiving pitches
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see a 3x3 grid marking the strike zone
AND each pitch coming in should have a description of what happened on the pitch displayed below the box
AND below that should be the speed and type of pitch
AND each pitch should be displayed in the area in the middle of the prop by a circle with the number of the pitch inside it
AND strikes should be marked with a solid red circle
AND balls should be marked with a solid green circle
AND balls hit into play should be marked by a solid blue circle

![](index.php?/attachments/get/27554)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a prop is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the prop should contain the following:

1. Background photo of player. In the case where the image is not found, we show a Default image.

2. Player headshot (top left)

3. Player name

4. "Batter Up" string

5. Prop question text

6. "+ Tap the card to expand" text

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps the card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the card should go to the expanded view of the card which displays the answer options

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user taps an option
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the option should register the selection and automatically minimize the card

title: Prop Scrolling
custom_steps: WHEN a user selects a game
custom_expected: THEN the prop deck should be shown, stacked when the page loads. The prop deck should not scroll through all of the cards to get to the last card in the deck.

title: No Pick
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is playing a game

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user does not make a pick on the OD player, AND the player is now at-bat
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the card locks as expected AND Pitchcast is shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the play is resolved
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN: 
1. Pitchcast image is removed
2. The card image turns black and white
2. Resolution details are shown
3. no pick made in the pick details
4. no points are awarded, which is reflected in the score at the top of the screen as well as the contest leaderboard

title: Voided

2. The card locks as expected
3. Pitchcast is shown
4. Pick is displayed at the top of the card

custom_steps_separated.content: Wipe resolution
custom_steps_separated.expected:

- Wipe color is grey
- 'VOIDED!" text is displayed. Text is uppercased with an exclamation mark and text has a neon shadow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the play is resolved
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN:
1. Pitchcast image is removed
2. The card image turns black and white. 
3. Resolution details are shown
4. Pick details are shown at the top of the card
5. "New Batter" is shown at the bottom with the details "There has been a change in the lineup, so this pick is canceled." (card view and extended card). 'VOIDED' wording is not there. 
6. no points are awarded, which is reflected in the score at the top of the screen as well as the contest leaderboard

2. The card locks as expected

title: Right/Left Handed

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the letter "R" should appear on the right hand side of the plate icon

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the letter "L" should appear next to the batter's name

custom_steps_separated.content: IF the batter is a lefty and the prop is locked
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the letter "L" should appear on the left hand side of the plate icon

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the letters "RHP" should appear on the left-hand side of the plate icon next to the pitcher's name

custom_steps_separated.content: IF the pitcher is a lefty and the prop is unlocked
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the letters "LHP" should appear on the left-hand side of the plate icon next to the pitcher's name

title: Pitcher takes the mound
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is viewing the pitchcast strikezone AND the pitcher takes the mound
custom_expected:
THEN:
1. The prop card is locked
2. The strikezone grid is displayed
3. The pitcher and batter are displayed at the bottom and have their simple matchup data attached
4. The home plate icon is displayed between the players and shows 0-0
5. Pick info is displayed at the top

title: A pitch is thrown
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is viewing the pitchcast strikezone AND a pitch is thrown
custom_expected:
THEN A dot is displayed in the vicinity of the strikezone grid in the position that the pitch crossed the plane
1. Dots will be color coded (see later steps)

Dot behavior:
1. each pitch is numbered inside of the dot
2. active pitch is bright and has a halo
3. previous pitch is bright but does not have a halo
4. the color of each pitch previous to that will get less bright
5. pitches should remain on the at-bat player's card and not transfer when switching cards

title: Strike/Foul
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is viewing the pitchcast strikezone AND a strike/foul has been thrown
custom_expected:
THEN a dot is displayed in the vicinity of the strikezone grid in the position that the pitch crossed the plane
1. the dot is red and includes pitch number
2. details on the pitch are displayed
3. the number on the right on the plate icon is increased

title: Ball
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is viewing the pitchcast strikezone AND a "ball" has been thrown
custom_expected:
THEN a dot is displayed in the vicinity of the strikezone grid in the position that the pitch crossed the plane
1. the dot is green and includes pitch number
2. details on the pitch are displayed
3. the number on the left on the plate icon is increased

title: Hit
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is viewing the pitchcast strikezone AND the pitch results in a hit
custom_expected:
THEN a dot is displayed in the vicinity of the strikezone grid in the position that the pitch crossed the plane
1. The dot is blue and includes pitch number
2. Pitch details are displayed
3. Play resolution is displayed

title: Pitch Description & Notification

custom_expected: As each pitch comes in, a short description what happened is shown on screen AND in the pitchcast feed.

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN show a short description of what happened

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the at-bat is over
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN show a short description of what happened

title: Vibration with every pitch
custom_expected:
When a user is in an In-Progress game, and a new pitch comes in, their device should vibrate.
Device should not vibrate when a user is not watching an In-Progress game, their phone is locked, or the app has been closed. Only when they're viewing a game.

title: Wipe resolution
custom_preconds: At bat has been completed
custom_steps: scroll to the card that requires resolution

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the play is resolved through hit, strikeout, or any other means
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 
1. The wipe resolution happens
2. A user should not be able to open the prop until the wipe completes

custom_steps_separated.content: After .5 seconds the at bat is resolved
custom_steps_separated.expected:
3. Card is wiped using relevant color and message (grey for void, red-ish for incorrect, green with points explosion for correct)
4. After wipe completes, the pitch cast info is removed and the card resolution is displayed. At bat details are displayed
5. Pick and details are shown

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Make a pick on an at-bat prop
2. Minimize the card and wait for the prop to resolve
3. When the notification icon appears signaling prop resolution, tap on it
4. While the prop resolution sequence is executing, swipe up and/or down
custom_steps_separated.expected: During the prop resolution, cards in background are not swipable

title: Triggered
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has made at least one pick that has been resolved
custom_steps: WHEN the user goes to a card that does not require resolution

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user has made one pick that has been resolved AND taps on the blue (!) that appears
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the card is displayed over the top 
AND the user should not be able to open the prop until the wipe is complete

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user has made multiple picks that have been resolved AND taps on the blue (!) that appears
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the card is displayed over the top 
AND the resolution animation including colored swipe 
AND any points rewarded are displayed 
AND the next prop animates until all the resolutions are complete AND the user should not be able to open the prop until the wipe is complete

title: Third out in an inning
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in an active game in the app
custom_steps: WHEN the user makes a pick on a card that comes after the player who causes the third out in an inning
custom_expected: THEN the prop should not show up in the resolutions AND the ! button should not appear

title: Feature:  Welcome screen
custom_preconds: Given:  After the user signs up and opens the app on a following day or later
custom_steps: When the user sees a splash screen and is automatically redirected to the Welcome screen
custom_expected: Then the user sees this message:  "Welcome <User Nickname>! Choose any game across the league to make your picks"

title: Feature:  Profile:  Predictions  Notification
custom_preconds: Given:  The user's mobile device is turned on
custom_steps:
When the user receives a MLB Rally notification
   And the notification reads:  "You have  predictions to make!  Come make your predictions on today's games!
   And the user taps the notification
custom_expected:
Then the user sees a Rally Space page
   And then sees the "Welcome <User Nickname>
   And Choose any..." text
   And today's <Day?Date>
   And a stack of tiles for today's games

title: Feature:  Profile:   Turn off notifications  and vibrations
custom_preconds:
Given:  The user's mobile device is turned on and the time is prior to the start of the first game
   And the user has made game selections for today's games
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to Profile>Notifications and Profile>Vibrations
   And slides both toggle switches to the 'off' position (blue background color on the toggle is dismissed)
custom_expected: Then the user does not see notifications or experience device vibrations while those switches are in the 'off' position

title: Feature:  Rally Bonus Bars: Start of Contest
custom_preconds: Given:  User has navigated to a prediction card (e.g. "What will happen in Adam Eaton's first at bat?) at the start of a contest
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the card
custom_expected: Then the user sees the first bar in the Bonus Bar progression

title: Feature:  Profile:   Rally Bonus Bars Progression
custom_preconds: Given:  A single game, in which the user has made correct predictions
custom_steps: When the user returns to the card of a correct prediction
custom_expected:
Then the user sees a green 'Bonus Bar'
   And for each correct At-Bat prediction, a Segment of the Bonus Bar is filled in
   And the number of Bonus points display far-right, just under the Bonus Bar 
   And As each Bonus Bar is filled, the next bar in the progression is shown

title: Feature:  Profile:   Bar>Segments>Bonus Bar # 1
custom_preconds: Given:  A single game, in which the user has completed the first bar correctly
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the Bonus Bar
custom_expected:
Then the green bar shows 3 segments 
   And 20 Bonus points displays as a number far-right, just under the Bonus Bar

title: Feature:  Profile:   Bar>Segments>Bonus Bar # 2
custom_preconds: Given:  A single game, in which the user has completed the second correctly
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the Bonus Bar
custom_expected:
Then the green bar shows 5 segments 
   And 50 Bonus points display as a number far-right, just under the Bonus Bar

title: Feature:  Profile:   Bar>Segments>Bonus Bar # 3
custom_preconds: Given:  A single game, in which the user has completed the third bar correctly
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the Bonus Bar
custom_expected:
Then the green bar shows 8 segments 
   And 150 Bonus points display as a number far-right, just under the Bonus Bar

title: Feature:  Profile:   Bar>Segments>Bonus Bar # 4
custom_preconds: Given:  A single game, in which the user has completed the fourth bar correctly
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the Bonus Bar
custom_expected:
Then the green bar shows 10 segments 
   And 450 Bonus points display as a number far-right, just under the Bonus Bar

title: Feature:  Profile:   Bar>Segments>Bonus Bar # 5
custom_preconds: Given:  A single game, in which the user has completed the fifth bar correctly
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the Bonus Bar
custom_expected:
Then the green bar shows 12 segments 
   And 1500 Bonus points display as a number far-right, just under the Bonus Bar

title: Feature:  Profile:   Bar # 5 Screen transitions to show total points, including bonus
custom_preconds: Given:  A single game, in which the user has made 5 predictions correctly, has completed
custom_steps: When the user is viewing the Bonus Bar and the screen transitions to a new view
custom_expected:
Then the player is awarded a bonus
   And the bonus displays in the center under the bar
   And the number shows in a screened down yellow type, "+1500"
   And over the screened down type, the total number of points, including the bonus, displays

**Example:**  
If the user earned 2,356 points from his/her selections, 
and earns a bonus of 1,500, 
then adding them together 
totals 3,856 points

title: Final Scores Flow - user played the game
custom_preconds: User played the game and game is finished

custom_steps_separated.content: Immediately after finishing, a card should be inserted, indicating that scores are being calculated.
custom_steps_separated.expected: ![](index.php?/attachments/get/25187)

custom_steps_separated.content: As soon as all of the scores have been calculated, and the pre-game props are all ready to be resolved, that card should be replaced with a card indicating that your score has completed along with a button that will immediately take you to the post-game flow.
custom_steps_separated.expected: ![](index.php?/attachments/get/25188)

custom_steps_separated.content: If user made picks for the pre-game props
custom_steps_separated.expected: Pressing the button should immediately start the pre-game prop resolution flow. (NOTE: This should be the only way to continue. There is NO blue exclamaition point)
AND after all of the pre-game props have resolved, go into the end of game flow immediately.

custom_steps_separated.content: If user didn't make picks for the pre-game props
custom_steps_separated.expected: End of the game flow starts immidiately

title: Final Scores Flow - user didn't play the game
custom_preconds: User didn't play the game and game is finished

custom_steps_separated.content: Immediately after game is finished, a card should be inserted, indicating the game scores
custom_steps_separated.expected: ![](index.php?/attachments/get/34182)

title: Leveling Up
custom_preconds: GIVEN a game that a player is participating in ends
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks into that contest OR they are already in it
AND the user has earned enough XP to level up
- note: If they have already seen the end of game flow for this contest, then clicking into the contest will just take the user to the card stack.
custom_expected:
THEN the user should experience a celebratory moment.
- Video for leveling up: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fkVWjWI0pvwfeORNqwruDi8ZUa9P_qSa/view
- Video for not leveling up: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1s2SluK1D1flb4XCi8vJHlWFBC_Shi0gM/view

title: Earning XP
custom_preconds: GIVEN a game that a player is participating in ends
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks into that contest OR they are already in it
- note: If they have already seen the end of game flow for this contest, then clicking into the contest will just take the user to the card stack.
custom_expected:
THEN the user is shown the below screen and awarded XP.
- Screen: https://zpl.io/aXmqAlK
- The amount of XP that is earned is determined by the formula in https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/FTP-508#icft=FTP-508

title: EOG flow
custom_expected: User is able to see the EOG flow just once.

custom_steps_separated.content: When all games are final
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Daily Prize Winners banner is shown in the leaderboard

![](index.php?/attachments/get/1675306)

custom_steps_separated.content: When user clicks on the Daily Prize Winners tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Prize winners page is open: 

Display: 
- "Prize winners" header
- For $day $date 
- Daily Prize Pool
- Users highlighted in green and have dollar icon 

![](index.php?/attachments/get/1677070)
The scroll should work smoothly. User is able to scroll up and down across the page
